summary: This is an email from a NY CART Coordinator/Senior Forensic Examiner inquiring about retrieving a 12 TB hard drive from 'Southern' to copy additional items before traveling to Denver. The document is marked as subject to a protective order.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: The sender of the email, requesting a 12 TB hard drive back from 'Southern' to copy 5 more items before traveling to Denver to visit a sister in hospice.

events.title: Planned evidence copying
events.description: The forensic examiner plans to copy all the items onto the 12 TB hard drive on Monday.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

events.title: Email request for hard drive
events.description: An email is sent requesting the return of a 12 TB hard drive from 'Southern' to facilitate copying additional evidence items.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

locations: Southern (likely a reference to a Southern District or location)
keyFacts: A forensic examiner is handling a 12 TB hard drive as part of an investigation, indicating large volumes of digital evidence.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17), suggesting sensitive or restricted information.
The examiner needs to copy 5 more items onto the drive before personal travel, showing ongoing evidence collection/processing.
The email is dated July 26, 2020, placing this activity years after Epstein's 2019 arrest and death.
